summary: A few weeks ago, I threw up a work in progress sketch of a 'certified Pokemon Trainer' concept and today, I'm showing it off!...
caption:
A few weeks ago, I threw up a work in progress sketch of a ‘certified Pokemon Trainer’ concept and today, I’m showing it off!
.
There are 2 designs: one boy, one girl, but each of them also comes with limited edition a variant color that you’ll see in image 3 and 4.
.
I would love to get these made into pins, so let me know if you’d be interested in this. 😊 I’ll do a preorder
.
#pokemongo #pokemon #pokemontrainer #anime #chibi #cute #enamelpins #enamelpin #enamelpindesign #enamelpingame #pincollector #pinaddict #pingame #pingamestrong #pinlover #pinsofinstagram #pins #pinspinspins #pinstagram #pinsofig #pindesign #pins

blog.name: everysinglepheel
blog.title: Wonderful Year Time
blog.description: (Avatar drawn by Cartoonspider!) The name's Pheel. I'm a dork who studied Geography and Spanish in college but don't be fooled idk what i wanna do with life. I love Pokemon and dragons and they're mostly what I reblog. I also like Mario, Rhythm Heaven, and Ouendan, and everything Nintendo really. Sometimes I draw. My art stuff is at reallypheelingit.tumblr.com! I also run everynowandthenkyurem!! I have an Arcanine sideblog! too! Finally, my flight rising sideblog is dire-vulture If you need me to tag anything please let me know! I'm awful at tagging but i will try.

title: Kyurem Day 2018!!
body:
Hello everybody!! Welcome to Kyurem Day 2018! Like last year, I’m gonna queue up about 30 or so kyurem drawings to post throughout the day on this blog, and if you don’t want to see anything, everything will be tagged #kyurem day. Hope everyone has a good one!! Thank you ❤️❤️❤️

(and now for the annual kyurem doodle spam)

blog.name: feriowind
blog.title: noot maniac
blog.description:
| feriowind |
| Taiwanese-American |
| Character/Concept Designer |

8V This is my casual blog where I'll be posting my art, and whatever else I'm interested in.

Main interests are Pacific Rim, Hunter x Hunter, and Metal Gear Solid, so expect those the most. If you are interested in using my art for icons/themes/etc please ask first. I am pretty lenient in general about this though so most likely I'll say yes, so uhh yeah just ask first, thanks.

My Art-only blog
My Twitter
My AO3

TAGS

Art
Animation
Comics

If you like my work and have some spare change around, maybe?

tags: i have so many ideas about this AU you dont even kNOW!!!!!!
also thank u janewestin for this au name i like it a lot
summary: i originally had more dragon types on newt’s team, but then i realized it would be a lot more cute/fun if his team consisted...
body:
i originally had more dragon types on newt’s team, but then i realized it would be a lot more cute/fun if his team consisted mostly of pokemon he befriended as a child (wimpod, poliwag, and venipede). Solosis was befriended when he studied them in his early college years as a teen, and tyrunt and archen, who both were recently revived from fossils and are honestly too young to do much, Newt’s both studying them and just raising them.

Newt also does have more Pokemon but they either live on the Pokemon ranch where trainers often deposit Pokemon, or they are simply free to travel to and fro at their leisure

also newt doesnt do pokemon battles, he panicks to easily and just feels a lot of guilt telling his pokemon to fight, so his pokemon fight on their own if the need ever arises

blog.name: weirdandwackypokefusions
blog.title: Well that's strange!
blog.description:
Welcome!  I create, using the all-mighty classic Microsoft XP Paint, my own pokemon fusions. All the sprites come from pokestadium and usually people on deviantart/ the xy/sun&moon sprite project. I don't own any of the sprite used, I just fuse them! 
REQUESTS ARE OPEN! Ask Box: 3/15.
PLEASE FEEL FREE TO DRAW MY FUSIONS!!  I absolutely love it when people draw them! There's no need to ask either! Just make sure you tag me so them I can see it!
I hope you enjoy my fusions!

summary: Mega Braixette Braixen and Mega Banette fusion Fire/Ghost Type Ability: Blaze Hidden Ability: Witch’s Curse - Curse activates on...
caption:
Mega Braixette

Braixen and Mega Banette fusion

Fire/Ghost Type

Ability: Blaze

Hidden Ability: Witch’s Curse - Curse activates on the opponent when the opponent attacks Mega Braixette.

The Cursed Witch Pokemon

This pokefusion lives in caves and makes magic potions to boost its spectral powers.  It is very picky about which stick it uses for its magic.  The ghostly stuff that comes out of its ears is actually bits of its true form leaking out.

Request for @therealmadlaugher​. I hope you like it!

blog.name: superdazmo
blog.title: Super Dazmo
blog.description:
Basically the inner workings of the mind of an insane obsessive compulsive geek.
How do I tumbl?

summary: Back at it with some Pokemon flash game fun straight from the Pokemon official website! This time around we're taking the role...
caption: Back at it with some Pokemon flash game fun straight from the Pokemon official website! This time around we’re taking the role of Alola’s very own Pikachu clone (that isn’t Mimikyu) in Togremaru’s Hop to the top! I can’t tell you how many times I’ve misspelled Togremaru during the process of this video. Douchebag Social Media: Twitch ► https://ift.tt/2KTjbY3 Discord Server ► https://ift.tt/2mKzmNm Twitter ► https://twitter.com/SuperDazmo Facebook ► https://ift.tt/2LpxSmZ Tumblr ► https://ift.tt/2KUXl6I Instagram ► https://ift.tt/2J969IW Snapchat ► SuperDazmo How to Play (from Pokemon.com): Step 1: Leafy Goodness When aiming Togedemaru for a landing, be sure to land on the trees’ leaves and not their branches. Togedemaru will safely bounce off the leaves, but fall right off the branch. Step 2: This Bark Has Bite Be careful about bumping into the trees on the sides of the screen. They send Togedemaru rebounding away rather quickly, which can cause you to miss your landing. Step 3: Branching Out The thin branches with no leaves are safe to bounce off, but watch out! After you jump on them, they break and fall away, meaning they’re only good for one hop. Step 4: Legends of the Fall The falling leaves may be a little tricky to land on, but they bounce you much higher than the stationary leaves. Master hopping off them to quickly boost your score!

blog.name: inikavulpixelreviews
blog.title: Let's Talk About Pokemon!
blog.description:
Reviewing my personal opinion on every single Pokemon! Yes, all 809 of them!
(Mostly) Daily Uploads, 3 PM EST.

summary: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - Elgyem and Beheeyem
title: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - Elgyem and Beheeyem
body:
605: Elgyem

While we’ve had a plenty handful of Pokemon that have their origins in space, it’s a surprise it’s taken just this long to finally get an outright space alien Pokemon in the most literal sense possible. But perhaps perfect they took this opportunity to do it in the American region given how much of a big deal aliens have been in modern American culture between UFO-spotting and the suspicions of Area 51. Sci-fi is also a pretty big deal around here, some of American pop-culture’s biggest icons being The Enterprise, E.T., the Xenomorph, or almost anything from Star Wars. Not to mention the image of an alien’s face is a pop-culture icon in and of itself, especially around the 90s and mid-2000s. Or at least that’s what I’ve observed when I was younger and sadly saw the thing phase out the older I got.

Elgyem is very clearly the spitting image of your stereotypical grey/green, naked, bug-eyed and big-headed space alien. But to solidify it as such, taking its name apart makes it “El G Yem”, or L.G.M. OR Little Green Men, a common nickname for the weird extra-terrestrials.

While the back-story behind it is neat, it’s perhaps a little disappointing the design itself isn’t super amazing. It’s a great Pokemonization of the traditional alien look, but it only shoots for the stars a little higher than that.

Personal Score: 7.5/10

A shame, since aliens certainly are a fun thing.

606: Beheeyem

But Beheeyem picks up the fun factor where Elgyem may have left it behind. I already appreciated the thing, but a detail that I never noticed until reading, you guessed it, Bogleech’s review is that the flaps of weird flesh and the shape of its head. I always knew they were meant to invoke clothing but figured it was some attempt at a weird sci-fi costume. But it actually looks like Beheeyem is attempting to blend into human society. Albeit not very well. Bless him, he’s trying.

And to fit right in with the alien theming, if this thing does get ahold of a person, it’s said they use their colored, glowing “fingers” to hypnotize people into coming with them. Not only that, but also be able to rewrite memories. Obvious shoutout to not just Men in Black, but also how a lot of alien abduction stories end in the person’s memory supposedly being wiped clean of the whole event.

And just as Elgyem calls out to Little Green Men, Beheeyem can be attributed to B.E.M., or Bug-Eyed Monster. Though I’ve also heard it’s also a call-out to yet another alien nickname, B.H.M., or Big-Headed Men. A slight stretch, but hey.

It certainly makes me hope they’ll one day do more sci-fi themed Pokemon. We got the absolute basic alien covered, along with one or two UFO-looking Pokemon. Perhaps something Xenomorph-ey? Or a rather direct Metroid Pokemon? Or an alien that at the same time doubles as a UFO!

Personal Score: 8.5/10

I will not be satisfied until we are overtaken by our new alien mutant cow overlords.

Overall:

Very fun and unappreciated designs!!

[Archive]

blog.name: pokebiologist
blog.title: Pokémon Biology
blog.description: I'm Theodora, but you can call me Thea! I'm a Battle Girl turned Pokémon Researcher, and I'm excited to share my observations with you. Feel free to ask, submit, request, and share your own findings!

summary: I’m looking to adopt a pair of Nidorans. Do you have any advice for picking them out, or better yet, rearing then?
question: I’m looking to adopt a pair of Nidorans. Do you have any advice for picking them out, or better yet, rearing then?
answer:
Hello, that’s so exciting! If this is your first time owning Pokémon, or even your first time training Poison-types, I recommend adopting from a certified breeder instead of going to a shelter.

Across the board, you’ll want to pick healthy Pokémon. When choosing a young Nidoran (either gender), you should look for bright eyes, reaction to noise and movement (bristling spikes, ear twitches, etc), plump bellies, and strong, white teeth and claws. Beyond that, it depends what you want them for. I’m assuming (and suggesting) that you’ll be picking from the same litter of Nidoran, so that you don’t have to worry about suddenly having more Pokémon than planned.

In terms of care, you’ll be dealing with skittish creatures that have strong foraging instincts. Keeping a mellow household with plenty of places for to hide, but not be stepped on, is key for establishing trust and happiness in your Pokémon. They gnaw and dig a lot as their teeth and claws never stop growing, so providing chew toys, scratching posts, and even areas like sand boxes for digging can greatly reduce any damage your furniture and floors would otherwise sustain.

If you already have other Pokémon, introduce your Nidoran to them slowly. Having a pair that can keep each other occupied and relaxed is a very good idea, but I would make sure that you have plenty of space available if you plan on evolving them, since Nidorino in particular need to run and tackle things.

And finally for food, while Nidoran love berries and things like jams and fruit juices are really exciting treats, they obtain next to no nutrients from fructose and other sugars. Leaving out important vitamins that are found in leafy greens, grasses, and grains can cause them to develop slowly or even develop less potent toxins.

-Thea
